title: Permits correction officers to be color blind
summary: Permits correction officers to be color blind.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1211

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. KOLB, HAWLEY, RAIA, MOLINARO, FINCH -- Multi-
         Sponsored by -- M. of A.   BARCLAY, CALHOUN, CROUCH,  JORDAN  --  read
         once and referred to the Committee on Correction

       AN ACT to amend the correction law, in relation to permitting correction
         officers to be color blind

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The correction law is amended by adding a new section  22-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 22-B. FURTHER QUALIFICATIONS FOR EMPLOYMENT AS A CORRECTION OFFICER.
    4  EVERY  APPLICANT FOR EMPLOYMENT AS A CORRECTION OFFICER WHO IS QUALIFIED
    5  FOR SUCH EMPLOYMENT SHALL BE DEEMED QUALIFIED EVEN IF SUCH APPLICANT  IS
    6  COLOR BLIND.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00462-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the correction law, in relation to permitting correction officers to be color blind
